args.pattern: a realized one exists after death

value.pattern: a realized one exists after death

sn44.6:2.1.pli: “Rūpārāmassa kho, āvuso, rūparatassa rūpasammuditassa rūpanirodhaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.6:2.1.en: “Reverend, if you like, love, and enjoy form, and don’t truly see the cessation of form, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ or

sn44.6:2.3.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.6:2.3.en: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ or

sn44.6:2.4.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.6:2.4.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.6:2.8.pli: viññāṇārāmassa kho, āvuso, viññāṇaratassa viññāṇasammuditassa viññāṇanirodhaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.6:2.8.en: consciousness, and don’t truly see the cessation of consciousness, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

sn44.6:2.9.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.6:2.9.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.6:3.6.pli: na viññāṇārāmassa kho, āvuso, na viññāṇaratassa na viññāṇasammuditassa, viññāṇanirodhaṁ jānato passato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…
sn44.6:3.6.en: consciousness, and you truly see the cessation of consciousness, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

sn44.6:3.7.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.6:3.7.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.6:4.3.pli: Bhavārāmassa kho, āvuso, bhavaratassa bhavasammuditassa, bhavanirodhaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.6:4.3.en: If you like, love, and enjoy existence, and don’t truly see the cessation of continued existence, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

sn44.6:4.4.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.6:4.4.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.6:4.5.pli: Na bhavārāmassa kho, āvuso, na bhavaratassa na bhavasammuditassa, bhavanirodhaṁ jānato passato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…
sn44.6:4.5.en: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy existence, and you truly see the cessation of continued existence, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

sn44.6:4.6.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.6:4.6.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.6:5.3.pli: Upādānārāmassa kho, āvuso, upādānaratassa upādānasammuditassa, upādānanirodhaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.6:5.3.en: If you like, love, and enjoy grasping, and don’t truly see the cessation of grasping, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

sn44.6:5.4.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.6:5.4.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.6:5.5.pli: Na upādānārāmassa kho, āvuso, na upādānaratassa na upādānasammuditassa, upādānanirodhaṁ jānato passato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…
sn44.6:5.5.en: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy grasping, and you truly see the cessation of grasping, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

sn44.6:5.6.pli: ‘neva, hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.6:5.6.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.6:6.3.pli: Taṇhārāmassa kho, āvuso, taṇhāratassa taṇhāsammuditassa, taṇhānirodhaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti …pe…
sn44.6:6.3.en: If you like, love, and enjoy craving, and don’t truly see the cessation of craving, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

sn44.6:6.4.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.6:6.4.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.6:6.5.pli: Na taṇhārāmassa kho, āvuso, na taṇhāratassa na taṇhāsammuditassa, taṇhānirodhaṁ jānato passato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti …pe…
sn44.6:6.5.en: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy craving, and you truly see the cessation of craving, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

sn44.6:6.6.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.6:6.6.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 44
1. The Undeclared Points
6. With Sāriputta and Koṭṭhita (4th)

an7.54:2.2.pli: ‘Hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, diṭṭhigatametaṁ;
an7.54:2.2.en: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is a misconception.

an7.54:2.4.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, diṭṭhigatametaṁ;
an7.54:2.4.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.

an7.54:2.5.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, diṭṭhigatametaṁ.
an7.54:2.5.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’: this is a misconception.

an7.54:3.3.pli: Evaṁ jānaṁ kho, bhikkhu, sutavā ariyasāvako evaṁ passaṁ ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti;
an7.54:3.3.en: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not answer: ‘A Realized One exists after death’,

an7.54:3.5.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti;
an7.54:3.5.en: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’,

an7.54:3.6.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti.
an7.54:3.6.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

an7.54:4.1.pli: ‘Hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, taṇhāgatametaṁ …pe…
an7.54:4.1.en: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is just about craving. …

an7.54:4.6.pli: ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, vippaṭisāro eso;
an7.54:4.6.en: ‘A Realized One exists after death’: this is a regret.

an7.54:4.8.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, vippaṭisāro eso;
an7.54:4.8.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.

an7.54:4.9.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, bhikkhu, vippaṭisāro eso.
an7.54:4.9.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’: this is a regret.

an7.54:5.3.pli: Evaṁ jānaṁ kho, bhikkhu, sutavā ariyasāvako evaṁ passaṁ ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti …pe…
an7.54:5.3.en: Knowing and seeing this, an educated noble disciple does not answer: ‘A Realized One exists after death’ …

an7.54:5.4.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipi na byākaroti.
an7.54:5.4.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 7
6. The Undeclared Points
54. The Undeclared Points

mn63:2.3.pli: ‘sassato loko’tipi, ‘asassato loko’tipi, ‘antavā loko’tipi, ‘anantavā loko’tipi, ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’tipi, ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’tipi, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipi, ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipi, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipi, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipi—
mn63:2.3.en: For example: the cosmos is eternal, or not eternal, or finite, or infinite; the soul and the body are the same thing, or they are different things; after death, a Realized One exists, or doesn’t exist, or both exists and doesn’t exist, or neither exists nor doesn’t exist.

mn63:3.25.en: that the world is finite, or infinite; that the soul and the body are the same thing, or they are different things; that after death, a Realized One exists, or doesn’t exist, or both exists and doesn’t exist, or neither exists nor doesn’t exist, please tell me.

mn63:5.4.pli: “neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā’ti,
mn63:5.4.en: or that after death a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist.’

mn63:5.34.pli: “neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā’ti—
mn63:5.34.en: or that after death a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist.’

mn63:6.13.pli: ‘Hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti, mālukyaputta, diṭṭhiyā sati brahmacariyavāso abhavissāti, evaṁ no.
mn63:6.13.en: ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

mn63:6.17.pli: ‘Hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti, mālukyaputta, diṭṭhiyā sati brahmacariyavāso abhavissāti, evaṁ no.
mn63:6.17.en: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ …

mn63:6.18.pli: ‘Neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti, mālukyaputta, diṭṭhiyā sati brahmacariyavāso abhavissāti, evampi no.
mn63:6.18.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’ there would be the living of the spiritual life.

mn63:7.15.en: ‘a Realized One exists after death,’

mn63:7.19.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti—
mn63:7.19.en: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death,’

mn63:7.21.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti—
mn63:7.21.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 63
The Shorter Discourse With Māluṅkya

sn44.4:1.4.pli: “Rūpaṁ kho, āvuso, ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, rūpasamudayaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, rūpanirodhaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, rūpanirodhagāminiṁ paṭipadaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.4:1.4.en: “Reverend, not truly knowing and seeing form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation, one thinks ‘a Realized One exists after death’ or

sn44.4:1.6.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.4:1.6.en: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ or

sn44.4:1.7.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
sn44.4:1.7.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.4:1.11.pli: viññāṇaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, viññāṇasamudayaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, viññāṇanirodhaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, viññāṇanirodhagāminiṁ paṭipadaṁ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.4:1.11.en: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation, one thinks ‘a Realized One exists after death’ or

sn44.4:1.13.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
sn44.4:1.13.en: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ or

sn44.4:1.14.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’”tipissa hoti.
sn44.4:1.14.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

sn44.4:2.6.pli: viññāṇaṁ jānato passato yathābhūtaṁ, viññāṇasamudayaṁ jānato passato yathābhūtaṁ, viññāṇanirodhaṁ jānato passato yathābhūtaṁ, viññāṇanirodhagāminiṁ paṭipadaṁ jānato passato yathābhūtaṁ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti;
sn44.4:2.6.en: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation, one doesn’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ or

sn44.4:2.8.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti;
sn44.4:2.8.en: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ or

sn44.4:2.9.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
sn44.4:2.9.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

an10.96:7.5.en: ‘A Realized One exists after death …’ …

an10.96:7.7.pli: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā …
an10.96:7.7.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death …’ …

an10.96:7.8.pli: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññanti—evaṁdiṭṭhi bhavan”ti?
an10.96:7.8.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

an10.96:13.7.en: ‘A Realized One exists after death …’ …

an10.96:13.9.pli: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā …
an10.96:13.9.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death …’ …

an10.96:13.10.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti kho, āvuso, diṭṭhigatametaṁ.
an10.96:13.10.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly:’ that’s a misconception.

mlDocs.title:
Heartfelt Sayings
Followers of Other Paths (1st)

mn72:9.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:9.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘A Realized One exists after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:11.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:11.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:12.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:12.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

dn15:32.8.pli: ‘Hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā itissa diṭṭhī’ti, tadakallaṁ.
dn15:32.8.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’;

dn15:32.9.pli: ‘Neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā itissa diṭṭhī’ti, tadakallaṁ.
dn15:32.9.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 15
The Great Discourse on Causation
1. Dependent Origination

dn29:30.2.pli: ‘kiṁ nu kho, āvuso, hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti?
dn29:30.2.en: ‘Is this your view: “A Realized One exists after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly”?’

dn29:30.12.pli: ‘kiṁ panāvuso, hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti?
dn29:30.12.en: ‘Then is this your view: “A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly”?’

dn29:30.17.pli: ‘kiṁ panāvuso, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti?
dn29:30.17.en: ‘Then is this your view: “A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly”?’

dn1:2.27.17.en: whether a Realized One exists after death …

dn1:2.27.19.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā …pe…
dn1:2.27.19.en: whether a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death …

dn1:2.27.20.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti iti ce maṁ pucchasi, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti iti ce me assa, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti iti te naṁ byākareyyaṁ,
dn1:2.27.20.en: whether a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. If I believed there was, I would say so.
